thread.title: First look: The stylish suites planned for Silversea Cruises' next ship
thread.title_full: First look: The stylish suites planned for Silversea Cruises' next ship

title: First look: The stylish suites planned for Silversea Cruises' next ship
text:
Among the most spacious accommodations on luxury line Silversea's new Silver Muse will be its four Owner's Suites, which will measure 1,389 square feet. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen Shown here in an artist's drawings, the Silver Muse's Owner's Suites will boast a large living room with sofa, chairs and a table area. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen The main bathrooms of the Silver Muse's Owner's Suites will be elegant and spacious. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen The Owner's Suites will have a second bedroom with its ownsitting area next to floor-to-ceiling windows. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen The second bedrooms in Owner's Suites will come with their own bathroom, as seen here in an artist's drawing. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen Even bigger than the Owner's Suite on the Silver Muse will be four Grand Suites that measure 1,475 square feet. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen An artist's drawing of the bedroom of a Grand Suite on the Silver Muse. Customers will be able to connect the suite to a second bedroom that will increase the size of the complex to more than 1,800 square feet. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen An artist's drawing of the living area planned for Grand Suites on the Silver Muse. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen The bathroom of a Grand Suite on the Silver Muse, as shown in an artist drawing. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen Also large at 1,130 square feet will be the Silver Muse's two Royal Suites. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen The Silver Muse's two Royal Suites also can be connected to a second bedroom to create a complex measuring 1,528 square feet. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen The bathroom of a Royal Suite on the Silver Muse, as seen in an artist's drawing. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen The living room area of a Royal Suite on the Silver Muse, as seen in an artist's drawing. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen The Silver Muse also will have 34 Silver Suites that measure 786 square feet. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen The Silver Muse's Silver Suites will feature a large bedroom that connects to a elegant living area overlooking the ocean. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen The large living room area planned for Silver Muse's Silver Suites, as seen in an artist's drawing. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen Even the smaller cabins on on the Silver Muse, such as Deluxe Veranda Suites, will be large by cruise ship standards at 387 square feet. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen Deluxe Veranda Suites on the Silver Muse will have a living area with a sofa just off the bed area. Silversea Cruises Fullscreen An artist's rendering of Silversea's next ship, Silver Muse, which is scheduled to debut in 2017. It'll be the line's largest vessel ever. Silversea Cruises The living room area of a Royal Suite on the Silver Muse, as seen in an artist's drawing. (Photo: Silversea Cruises)
2 CONNECT 4 TWEET 1 LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Silversea Cruises is promising some of the most luxurious accommodations at sea for the new ship it recently ordered for 2017.
As can be seen in the newly released artist's drawings in the carousel above, the top suites of the luxury line's 596-passenger Silver Muse will be among the biggest and most elegant at sea and feature a contemporary look dressed in warm earth tones of cream, saffron, green and sienna.
Silversea on Tuesday revealed the vessel will boast the highest number of large suites in its fleet including four apartment-like Owner's Suite that have two bedrooms a piece and measure 1,389 square feet. There also will be four Grand Suites and two Royal Suites that measure 1,475 square feet and 1,130 square feet, respectively.
The ship also will have 34 of the line's signature Silver Suites across three top decks, including a new two-bedroom Silver Suite configuration that measures 1,119 square feet.
USA TODAY
A new, more luxurious way to explore the Galapagos
As previously announced , the Silver Muse will be an all-suite vessel with even the smallest cabins measuring nearly 400 square feet. Silversea on Tuesday also said the ship will have more connecting suites for use by extended families and groups of friends than any other Silversea vessel.
Scheduled to debut in spring 2017, the Silver Muse will be Silversea's largest vessel to date at 40,700 tons and serve as its new flagship. It'll have 298 suites in all.
Founded in 1994, Silversea is considered one of the world's most upscale cruise lines. For a deck-by-deck tour of one of its current vessels, scroll through the carousel below.
The oldest and smallest vessel in luxury cruise line Silversea’s quintet of five star cruise ships, the sleek, yacht-like MV Silver Cloud was launched in 1994. It was joined by a nearly identical twin, the MV Silver Wind, in 1995. Peter Knego Fullscreen Measuring 16,800 gross tons, the 514-by-71 foot Silver Cloud has a capacity for 296 guests, giving it one of the cruise industry’s highest passenger space ratios of 56:8. Peter Knego Fullscreen The Silver Cloud’s hull was built by the Visentini Shipyard near Trieste, Italy and outfitted by the T. Mariotti Shipyard in Genoa. The ship is powered by diesel engines that drive twin screws at a service speed of 18 knots with a maximum speed of 20.5 knots. Peter Knego Fullscreen Most recently refurbished in 2012, the Silver Cloud has six passenger decks and is manned by a European-trained, International staff of 222. Peter Knego Fullscreen In luxury cruise ship tradition, guests embarking the Silver Cloud are welcomed with a glass of champagne. Peter Knego Fullscreen At the top of the ship, Deck 9 begins with an open observation and sunning area. Peter Knego Fullscreen Deck 9 continues aft of the Fitness Center with a sheltered sunning space. Peter Knego Fullscreen The midship portion of Deck 9 overlooks the pool area. Peter Knego Fullscreen A jogging track continues aft of the pool area on Deck 9. Ten laps equals a mile. Peter Knego Fullscreen More sunning space is located in the far aft portion of Deck 9. Peter Knego Fullscreen The Pool Grill casual eatery seats up to 70 guests and occupies the starboard forward portion of the pool area on Deck 8. Peter Knego Fullscreen The port forward corner of the pool area is home to the Pool Bar, which accommodates up to 92 guests. Peter Knego Fullscreen Teak wood decking surrounds the pool and two jacuzzis on midship Deck 8. Peter Knego Fullscreen At the far aft end of Deck 8, there is a sheltered terrace with seating that overlooks the ship’s wake. Peter Knego Fullscreen Forward and aft (shown) staircases and four elevators link Silver Cloud’s six passenger decks Peter Knego Fullscreen The aft staircase features an arc-shaped, with open stair towerson either side. Peter Knego Fullscreen The Silver Cloud’s well-equipped Fitness Center is located at the forward end of Deck 9 and features cardio machines, weight machines and free weights. Peter Knego Fullscreen Off the starboard entrance to the Panorama Lounge on Deck 8, the Connoisseur’s Club cigar and smoking room seats up to 7 guests and offers a selection of fine cigars and cognacs for purchase. Peter Knego Fullscreen Located on aft Deck 8, the Panorama Lounge seats 138 guests and features a bar, dance floor and ocean views via full length windows on three sides. Peter Knego Fullscreen The Panorama Lounge is used for a number of activities from dance classes and language lessons to quizzes and games. Late at night, it becomes the ship’s nightclub. Peter Knego Fullscreen The Silver Spa is located on Deck 7 and features both men’s and women’s saunas as well as a fully equipped Beauty Salon offering a wide range of treatments, from hair styling and manicures to pedicures. Peter Knego Fullscreen The Spa also has a pair of treatment rooms with a variety of massage and skin therapies. This treatment room has an ocean view. Peter Knego Fullscreen This is the interior treatment room. Peter Knego Fullscreen The Library is on midship Deck 7 across from the Spa and boasts an extensive collection of books, DVDs and international newspapers. Peter Knego Fullscreen The Deck 6 lobby is home to the Cruise Consultant’s desk, Reception and Shore Excursion offices. Peter Knego Fullscreen A 30-seat Card and Conference Room is located along the aft/starboard portion of Deck 6. Peter Knego Fullscreen Adjacent to the Card Room, the Internet Center has six private computer workstations (internet access is available at an extra charge). Peter Knego Fullscreen The Silver Cloud has a state-of-the-art, double deck showroom on aft Decks 6 and 5 with tiered seating alcoves. Peter Knego Fullscreen The Showroom is equipped with the latest in sound and visual technology as well as a telescopic stage. Peter Knego Fullscreen Special events such as the Captain’s Welcome Reception are held in the Showroom along with intensive enrichment lecture programs, cooking demonstrations and other activities. Peter Knego Fullscreen At night, the Showroom is home to Broadway-style productions featuring the ship’s orchestra and six member cast as well as guest singers and musicians. Peter Knego Fullscreen The entrance lobby spans the width of the ship on midship Deck 5. Peter Knego Fullscreen A small jewelry boutique is located on the starboard side of the entrance lobby on Deck 5. Peter Knego Fullscreen A larger boutique can be found on the port side of Deck 5. Peter Knego Fullscreen Poker, black jack, roulette and slot machines can be enjoyed in the Casino on port Deck 5. Peter Knego Fullscreen The handsome Bar spans the width of the ship on Deck 5, with a seating capacity of 92 guests. Passages lead aft from here to the lower level of the Showroom. Peter Knego Fullscreen There is a self-service, complimentary Launderette on forward Deck 4. Peter Knego Fullscreen Seating 324 guests, The Restaurant is Silver Cloud’s main eatery and is located on aft Deck 4. It features a domed center section and picture windows on either side and aft. Peter Knego Fullscreen Dining in the Restaurant is an elegant, open seating, multi-course event that begins with a choice of included wines for lunch and dinner. Peter Knego Fullscreen Silversea’s cuisine has a genuine Italian flair and is among the best at sea. Even simple courses like spaghetti pomodoro and homemade salt caramel gelato are of the finest quality. Peter Knego Fullscreen Located on aft Deck 8, La Terrazza is Silver Cloud’s 172-seat casual eatery, offering a combination of buffet and menu service for breakfast and lunch. Peter Knego Fullscreen La Terrazza has an al fresco terrace directly aft with a view overlooking the ship’s wake. Peter Knego Fullscreen La Terrazza’s buffet has courses such as smoked salmon and lox with all the trimmings for breakfast and sushi, cold cuts, a salad bar, pizza and pasta for lunch. Peter Knego Fullscreen At 4:00 PM each day, La Terrazza is the setting for an afternoon tea with a choice of twelve freshly brewed tea leaves or any combination thereof. Peter Knego Fullscreen Highlights at tea time include special daily confections such as chocolate pancakes, a selection of cookies, tarts, finger sandwiches and scones with clotted cream. Peter Knego Fullscreen Each evening, La Terrazza becomes a reservations-required, full-service Italian Trattoria with limited seating for just 110 guests. Peter Knego Fullscreen Dinner in La Terrazza begins with an outstanding selection of breads. Peter Knego Fullscreen The Pool Grill transforms into The Grill each evening with a fixed menu of prime cuts and fresh fish that guests can grill on a tabletop black stone to their liking. Peter Knego Fullscreen Dinner in the al fresco, candlelit Grill begins with homemade chips, pico de gallo and guacamole. Peter Knego Fullscreen A selection of side dishes such as baked potato with all the trimmings, steamed veggies and mashed potatoes accompany the main course in The Grill. Peter Knego Fullscreen Le Champagne is Silver Cloud’s only extra-tariff dining venue and features a fixed menu curated by Relais et Chateaux. Located on the starboard side of Deck 4, it accommodates 40 guests. Peter Knego Fullscreen Table settings in Le Champagne include elegant linens, flatware and stemware. Peter Knego Fullscreen Located at midship on Deck 6, the 587-square-foot Owner’s Suite tops the accommodation tier aboard Silver Cloud. This is a view of the spacious living room area. Peter Knego Fullscreen In addition to a living room, the Owner’s Suite has a private dining nook and can be expanded to 827-square-feet by annexing the adjacent suite. Peter Knego Fullscreen This is the Owner’s Suite bedroom. Peter Knego Fullscreen All suites on the Silver Cloud have a walk-in closet but the one in the Owner’s Suite is especially large. Peter Knego Fullscreen The Owner’s Suite balcony has space for a lounger, two chairs and a small dining table. It can be accessed from the living room and the bedroom. Peter Knego Fullscreen The marble top bathroom in the Owner’s Suite has a tub in addition to a shower. Peter Knego Fullscreen Nespresso machines and a supply of espresso can be found in the Owner’s Suite, the Grand Suites, Royal Suites and Silver Suites aboard the Silver Cloud. Peter Knego Fullscreen The top four suite categories aboard the Silver Cloud also feature CD players. Peter Knego Fullscreen Owner’s, Grand and Royal Suites have a separate powder room. Peter Knego Fullscreen Sporting a similar layout to the even larger Grand Suites, two 736-square-foot Royal Suites are located at the forward end of the ship and feature an elegantly curved living and dining room area. Peter Knego Fullscreen Royal Suite bedrooms have a picture window instead of balcony access. Peter Knego Fullscreen A passageway in the Royal Suite serves as the walk-in closet and provides access to the bathroom. Peter Knego Fullscreen Royal Suites have forward-facing verandas. Peter Knego Fullscreen This is the tub and shower area in a Royal Suite. Peter Knego Fullscreen Luxe Bvlgari products (shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, lotion) are provided in all suite categories aboard Silversea’s ships. Peter Knego Fullscreen Three 541-square-foot Silver Suites with spacious dining and living areas are located on midship Decks 5, 6, and 7. Peter Knego Fullscreen This is the bedroom of a Silver Suite. Peter Knego Fullscreen Silver Suite balconies are especially wide and are furnished with a pair of rattan chairs and a lounger. Peter Knego Fullscreen This is the walk-in closet of a Silver Suite. Peter Knego Fullscreen 102 Veranda Suites comprise the majority of Silver Cloud’s accommodation and measure a generous 295-square-feet. Peter Knego Fullscreen The living room portion of a Veranda Suite can be partitioned off from the bedroom with a curtain. Peter Knego Fullscreen Veranda Suites have teak-lined balconies that measure 49-square-feet. Peter Knego Fullscreen This is the walk-in closet in a Veranda Suite. Peter Knego Fullscreen Veranda Suite bathrooms are richly appointed in veined marble and dark wood tones. Peter Knego Fullscreen Showers in all suites feature a rainforest and a massage shower head. Peter Knego Fullscreen 36 Vista Suites are similarly appointed to Veranda Suites but have a picture window in lieu of a balcony and measure 240-square feet. Peter Knego Fullscreen Vista Suite bathrooms are also identical to those in Veranda Suites. Peter Knego Fullscreen Vista Suite 451 has been specially modified to accommodate guests in wheelchairs. Peter Knego Fullscreen 81. The bathroom in Vista Suite 451 has an especially large shower with an unfolding seat to accommodate guests in wheelchairs.
